title: Account Development Manager
description:
At Blueground, we are guided by a vision to make people feel at home wherever they choose to live. By offering fully-furnished apartments that are move-in ready in the world’s most vibrant neighborhoods, we provide our guests with the opportunity to simply #ShowUpStartLiving. Behind the scenes, we strive for a tech-powered living experience that guests love, homed in an organization where great people are proud to work.

We’ve grown a lot since our founding in 2013. We are now hosting guests in more than 4,000 homes in 15 cities. We have raised more than $100m+ in funding to date and that’s just the beginning

What drives our success is how each of our team members applies our core values. To our team, Time is everything, and we cherish it greatly. For us, Excellence isn’t simply a standard, but an exciting way to look at life. We Care deeply about our clients and colleagues and never lose sight of the human element, which goes hand-in-hand with Transparency which we believe makes our day-to-day life easier.

We are currently seeking to recruit an Account Development Manager based in either in Seattle, San Francisco or Los Angeles. As a member of our enterprise sales team, you will develop and grow corporate accounts by conducting outbound sales to companies that would benefit from Blueground’s services. You’ll work in an exciting and collaborative environment, surrounded by talented and motivated colleagues. On top of it all, you’ll be joining a fast growing company!

What you will mostly focus on:

  • Create a sales pipeline and close new corporate accounts through proactive outreach to prospective clients utilizing a combination of email campaigns, networking and market research
  • Communicate value propositions to clients that speak intimately to their needs and requirements
  • Cultivate and build strong business relationships with key corporate decision makers (i.e. HR, Procurement, Travel Managers, Global Mobility, Office Managers).
  • Build and strengthen relationships with existing enterprise clients
  • Forecast and track key account metrics

What we are looking for:

  • 5+ years progressive experience in b2b sales and account management
  • Effective and persuasive communicator (both verbal and written) with an ability to clearly summarize Blueground's value proposition
  • Excellent account management skills and customer centric attitude
  • Knowledge of and network in the mobility and corporate housing space is an advantage

Your benefits:

  • Competitive salary
  • Flexible paid time off
  • Enhanced parental leave
  • 401k retirement plan
  • Competitive Health insurance (Medical, Dental and Vision), along with complimentary access to OneMedical and Health Advocate
  • Dynamic working environment with talented people
  • Complimentary accommodation in Blueground locations. Think summer in Greece and winter in Dubai!

At Blueground we are proud to have Diversity and Inclusion at the centre of everything we do. We are committed to Equal Employment Opportunity regardless of race, colour, national origin, ethnicity, gender, age, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or religion.

title: Guest Operations Specialist
description:
At Blueground, we are guided by a vision to make people feel at home wherever they choose to live. By offering fully-furnished apartments that are move-in ready in the world’s most vibrant neighborhoods, we provide our guests with the opportunity to simply #ShowUpStartLiving. Behind the scenes, we strive for a tech-powered living experience that guests love, homed in an organization where great people are proud to work.

We’ve grown a lot since our founding in 2013. We are now hosting guests in more than 4,000 homes in 15 cities. We have raised more than $100m+ in funding to date and that’s just the beginning.

What drives our success is how each of our team members applies our core values. To our team, Time is everything, and we cherish it greatly. For us, Excellence isn’t simply a standard, but an exciting way to look at life. We Care deeply about our clients and colleagues and never lose sight of the human element, which goes hand-in-hand with Transparency which we believe makes our day-to-day life easier.

We are looking for a Guest Operations Specialist to join our fast growing San Jose team. The ideal candidate should be a stickler for detail, proactive, skilled in general maintenance tasks and thoughtful as to ensure that the property is continuously in pristine condition for our guests. The role is primarily responsible for assisting our Operations Team in preparing new units, ensuring that existing units are perfect for our guests, and handling any issues or emergencies that arise. These issues include but are not limited to handling guest lockouts, emergency relocations, as well as keeping Operations Managers informed of potential repairs and actions being taken.

Note that this role will work on a Tuesday-Saturday schedule on a permanent basis. The person will need to be located close to the East Bay area.

What you’ll focus on:

  • Work with our team of Operations Managers to ensure our properties are fully-equipped and move-in ready for our guests.
  • "Be Blueground's "boots on the ground" to help resolve issues impacting our guests such as handling guest concerns, requests, maintenance matters/repairs and technology issues (e.g., supervising handyman/locksmith/plumber, managing deliveries, handling building maintenance/follow-up, resolving WIFI/TV issues, etc.)
  • Perform unit check-in & check-outs before and after every guest stay to ensure each apartment meets business + guest quality standards
  • Carry out Blueground homes walkthroughs to ensure all quality assurance criteria are met when it comes to post maintenance/service requests, interiors/furnishing specifications, and overall design and aesthetics
  • Showcase your knack for custom-centricity by being the main point of contact between our guests and the Customer Experience team
  • Balance workflow processes with independent on-the-go work most of the time, and desk-based tasks (e.g., email, slack, G-suite) the rest of the time

What we’re looking for:

  • Problem solver, with ability to work in a fast-paced and "get the job done" culture
  • Enthusiasm to own a part in driving operational excellence
  • Detail-oriented
  • Confident user of technology (email, slack, G suite)
  • Access to a reliable vehicle & driver’s license for roles based in certain markets (e.g., SF/Bay Area, Seattle, Los Angeles) with reimbursement for mileage
  • A positive, driven, upbeat and friendly personality

Your benefits:

  • Be part of a fast-growing global startup that’s shaping the future of renting & living around the world
  • Competitive salary
  • Flexible paid time off
  • Enhanced parental leave
  • 401k retirement plan
  • Corporate cell phone plan
  • Competitive Health insurance (Medical, Dental and Vision), along with complimentary access to OneMedical and Health Advocate
  • Complimentary accommodation in Blueground locations. Think summer in Greece and winter in Dubai!

At Blueground we are proud to have Diversity and Inclusion at the centre of everything we do. We are committed to Equal Employment Opportunity regardless of race, colour, national origin, ethnicity, gender, age, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or religion.

We are looking for a Business Analyst to join our high performing team based in Athens. Business Analysts at Blueground focus on identifying opportunities, conducting rigorous analyses, defining metrics, and generating insights to provide actionable recommendations. As a Business Analyst you will work cross-functionally with Marketing, Sales, and city General Managers across multiple markets. This is a great opportunity to develop your career in a fast growing global organisation.

What you will focus on:

  • Define market level strategy and support pricing operations
  • Develop dashboards and reports to assess the performance and impact of pricing decisions
  • Lead cross-functional projects & partner with managers to better understand business goals, develop strategies & ensure successful implementation
  • Build models to evaluate the economic and strategic costs and benefits of every market
  • Communicate data analyses and recommendations to leadership and relevant stakeholders
  • Collaborate with the Business Intelligence team to develop demand and pricing forecasting models
  • Research market trends and competitor data to identify revenue optimization opportunities

What we are looking for:

  • 2+years of relevant experience as a Business Analyst
  • Bachelor’s degree from a top-tier university
  • Strong analytical and communication skills
  • Be data-driven and detail-oriented, with an eye for the larger picture and long-term implications
  • Ability to work cross-functionally, drive alignment, and deliver results in a fast-paced environment
  • Advanced excel skills
  • Fluency in English
  • Working knowledge of SQL, Tableau, and/or Google Sheets will be considered a plus

Your benefits:

  • Workstation of your choice
  • Competitive salary
  • Annual Performance Bonus
  • Group Health Insurance program
  • Mobile Data Plan
  • Flexible paid time off
  • Enhanced parental leave
  • Dynamic working environment with talented people
  • Complimentary accommodation in Blueground locations. Think summer in LA and winter in Dubai!

  • Flexible work environment through our Blueground Nomads employee mobility program

title: General Manager - Austin
description:
At Blueground, we are guided by a vision to make people feel at home wherever they choose to live. By offering fully-furnished apartments that are move-in ready in the world’s most vibrant neighborhoods, we provide our guests with the opportunity to simply #ShowUpStartLiving. Behind the scenes, we strive for a tech-powered living experience that guests love, homed in an organization where great people are proud to work.

We’ve grown a lot since our founding in 2013. We are now hosting guests in more than 4,000 homes in 15 cities. We have raised more than $100m+ in funding to date and that’s just the beginning.

What drives our success is how each of our team members applies our core values. To our team, Time is everything, and we cherish it greatly. For us, Excellence isn’t simply a standard, but an exciting way to look at life. We Care deeply about our clients and colleagues and never lose sight of the human element, which goes hand-in-hand with Transparency which we believe makes our day-to-day life easier.

We are currently recruiting a General Manager for the recently launched market of Austin.

The GM position is one of the most exciting and impactful roles at Blueground. As the leader of Austin office and a member of Blueground’s global leadership team, you will own your P&L and manage all business activities: from hiring your team, to on-boarding and marketing units, to building strong relationships with the local real estate industry. You will be responsible for launching, scaling and owning the Austin market. If you like ownership, leadership and hustling, while being very strategic and analytical in your approach, this is the right role for you.

What you will focus on:

  • Owning the P&L for Blueground's Austin business
  • Building and scaling a best-in-class team for real estate, operations and sales
  • Defining city priorities and goals, and managing performance on a monthly and quarterly basis by setting relevant KPIs and incentive structure
  • Identifying unexplored opportunities and adapting the business model to local requirements, taking into account local regulatory constraints
  • Staying actively educated on Austin real estate trends to adapt and refine leasing strategy
  • Shaping and sharing best practices with the rest of the network towards the constant efficiency improvement of our global operations.
  • Being the face of Blueground in Austin - local PR and networking events
  • Collaborating with Product, Revenue Management, Marketing, Technology and Client Experience teams to meet the needs of local market

What we are looking for:

  • Relevant experience (at least 3 years) in leading teams
  • Experience in launching new markets - scaling teams in a startup setup will be considered a big plus
  • Entrepreneurial drive, adaptability, and focus on results
  • A combination of strategic/analytical thinking and hands on mentality
  • Ability to work independently, effectively and efficiently
  • P&L experience
  • Excellent communication skills
  • Demonstrated ability to lead complex operational and strategic initiatives
  • Proven record of data-driven decision making

Your benefits:

  • Competitive salary
  • Competitive Health insurance (Medical, Dental and Vision), along with complimentary access to OneMedical and Health Advocate
  • Flexible paid time off
  • Enhanced parental leave
  • Dynamic working environment with talented people
  • Complimentary accommodation in Blueground locations. Think summer in Greece and winter in Dubai!

Internally, this is one of our most cross-functional roles as it works closely with Enterprise Sales, Operations, and Marketing to provide concierge-level support in resolving issues.

What you will focus on:

  • Actively manage a remote team to ensure they are consistently meeting SLAs and quality metrics
  • Partner with Enterprise Sales, Inbound Sales, and Marketing to understand the needs of incoming corporate guests from relocation management companies
  • Coordinate within CX as well as across Operations, and Sales to ensure apartments are equipped to meet the personalized needs of incoming guests
  • Serve as an escalation point for complex or urgent issues.

What we are looking for:

Successful candidates for this role will have a proven track record of managing high-paced, high-performing teams in a service environment. There are core working hours for this role that are pacific standard time with the expectation to work weekends. We provide generous time-off policies and respect a healthy work-life balance. That said, this is a salaried position that brings commensurate expectations for flexibility to respond to guest and business needs.

  • Core working hours of 10 am to 7 pm PST with the flexibility to work regular weekends
  • 7+ years experience in a customer service role, ideally in corporate housing or real estate
  • 5+ years leading a team to meet KPIs in a service environment
  • Strong prioritization and organization skills and the ability to multi-task competing priorities
  • Nice to have: experience in a start-up environment as well as using Zendesk or Salesforce
  • Minimum Bachelor’s degree

description:

We Care deeply about our clients and colleagues and never lose sight of the human element, which goes hand-in-hand with Transparency which we believe makes our day-to-day easier.

We are looking for a General Manager for our imminent launch in the city of Madrid.

The GM position is one of the most exciting and impactful roles at Blueground. As the leader of Madrid office and a member of Blueground’s global leadership team, you will own your P&L and manage all business activities: from hiring your team, to on-boarding and marketing units, to building strong relationships with the local real estate industry. You will be responsible for launching, scaling and owning the Madrid market. If you like ownership, leadership and hustling, while being very strategic and analytical in your approach, this is the right role for you.

What you will focus on:

  • Owning the P&L for Blueground's Madrid's business
  • Building and scaling a best-in-class team for real estate, operations and sales
  • Defining city priorities and goals, and managing performance on a monthly and quarterly basis by setting relevant KPIs and incentive structure

  • Staying actively educated on Madrid's real estate trends to adapt and refine leasing strategy
  • Shaping and sharing best practices with the rest of the network towards the constant efficiency improvement of our global operations.
  • Being the face of Blueground in Madrid - local PR and networking events
  • Collaborating with Product, Revenue Management, Marketing, Technology and Client Experience teams to meet the needs of local market

What we are looking for:

  • Relevant experience (at least 5 years) in leadership roles and ideally managing own P&L and building a high-performing team
  • Entrepreneurial drive, adaptability, and focus on results
  • Ability to work independently, effectively and efficiently
  • Demonstrated ability to lead complex operational and strategic initiatives
  • Analytical and data-driven decision making
  • A team player that will fit with our values and add to our culture

Your benefits:

  • Competitive salary
  • Discretionary annual bonus scheme
  • Stock options plan
  • Flexible paid time off

You’ll have a strong command of data, statistical and algorithmic techniques as well as a demonstrated practical ability to determine where to invest time. The role is primarily responsible for coordinating with all of our suppliers and utility providers for our apartments, administering expenses, as well as ensuring that existing units are perfect for our guests, and handling any issues or emergencies that arise. These issues include but are not limited to handling guest lockouts, emergency relocations, as well as keeping Operations Managers informed of potential repairs and actions being taken..

This position will have either a Tuesday to Saturday schedule or a Sunday to Thursday schedule.

What you will focus on:

  • Manage scheduling of issues resolution around our guests, while handling any guest concerns, requests, maintenance matters/repairs and technology issues (e.g., supervising handyman/locksmith/plumber, managing deliveries, handling building maintenance/follow-up, resolving WIFI/TV issues, etc.)
  • Order, create an inventory list and maintain supplies for the janitorial vendors
  • Carry out Blueground homes walkthroughs to ensure all quality assurance criteria are met when it comes to post maintenance/service requests, interiors/furnishing specifications, and overall design and aesthetics
  • Perform unit check-in & check-outs before and after every guest stay to ensure each apartment meets business + guest quality standards
  • Oversee a clean and organized storage unit at all times
  • Be the main point of contact between our vendors and our Operations team
  • Support our Operations Managers in general administrative tasks such as setting up utility accounts for new apartments and troubleshooting issues with existing accounts, mail distribution for the office, and logging in invoices into a Google Sheet
  • Balance workflow processes with independent on-the-go work and desk-based tasks (e.g., email, slack, G-suite, phone)

Additional tasks may include:

  • Assist with coordination of office events and activities
  • Provide assistance to Operations Managers during apartment installations
  • Perform check-in/outs to our properties according to business standards

What we are looking for:

  • Willingness to take ownership to achieve operational excellence
  • Problem solver, with ability to work in a fast-paced and "get the job done" culture
  • Detailed oriented
  • Flexibility to work weekends and or evenings if needed
  • Confident user of technology (email, slack, G suite)
  • Access to a reliable vehicle & clean driver’s license
  • A positive, driven, upbeat and friendly personality
  • Located within 45minutes from Culver City

We are seeking an Assistant General Counsel, Real Estate based in our New York (Remote) office to join our legal team and report directly to our General Counsel. You will be a strategic thought partner and act as a real estate and special counsel, managing all legal aspects for Blueground's real estate and core operations. Most importantly, you’ll work in an exciting and collaborative environment, surrounded by talented and motivated colleagues.

What you will focus on:

  • Draft and negotiate sophisticated lease agreements, lease amendments, letters of intent, REA documents, consent letters and other relevant real estate legal documents.
  • Provide regulatory advice regarding changes in landlord-tenant laws and law impacting intermediate term housing
  • Draft high priority real estate legal documents and counsels business partners on leasing and master lease agreement, revenue sharing, joint ventures or partnership agreements.

  • Work closely with business clients throughout stages of transaction.
  • Identify and assess risk to the company, recommend courses of action and develop solutions
  • Interface with business units and cross-functional teams within Blueground
  • Provide guidance and training to real estate junior team members
  • Process confidential data and maintain complete discretion
  • Direct and oversee outside counsel, if needed

  • Law degree from an American Bar Association accredited law school / Must satisfy Minimum Continuing Legal Education (MCLE) requirements to maintain active license to practice law
  • Minimum 3+ years’ relevant experience with a background in commercial and or residential real estate law, including lease drafting and negotiation, commercial contracts, and corporate law
  • Landlord-tenant law (in particular evictions); experience in New York and California would be considered as a plus; experience with Fair Debt Collection Practices Act would be considered a plus
  • Transactional experience, such as working on mergers, venture matters and/or public company reporting, is a plus
  • Excellent PC skills, including Microsoft Office and Excel
  • Ability to work under pressure and identify, prioritize and resolve issues quickly and independently
  • Excellent communication and project management skills, with demonstrated ability to lead cross-functional initiatives

The platform team is responsible for providing a centralized system to organize, schedule, and manage the Bluegrounders' day-to-day workflows in order to offer a delightful customer experience. The team is building the technology to:

  • Support all steps of our operational process from onboarding and furnishing a new property to publishing it to our website and other channels.
  • Streamline the end-to-end booking experience by incorporating all booking details like payments and customer requests.
  • Connect internal systems with external tools used by our teams through seamless integrations.

You will be responsible for the vision, strategy, and execution of all initiatives that ensure our teams can efficiently operate and provide an amazing customer experience to our guests. This is a highly cross-functional role that is critical for the success of the company. You will be a strategic partner to department heads from several functions that define the Blueground experience, including Sales, Customer Support, Operations, Real Estate, Finance, Accounting, etc. Your goal will be to deeply understand customer needs and craft the right solutions to address them.


What you will focus on:

  • Define product vision, strategy, and metrics for the platform team.
  • Be a strategic partner to stakeholders across departments to ensure Blueground provides the best possible customer experience.
  • Develop a product roadmap and build consensus on prioritization.
  • Drive product execution, partnering with a team of world-class engineers and designers, optimally trading speed of delivery and long-term thinking.

What we are looking for:

  • Experience: 4+ years of product management experience. Experience with technical products is a plus.
  • Product Management Leadership: drive a world-class vision, strategy, planning, and execution.
  • Customer obsession: deeply understand customer needs and design solutions that delight customers.
  • Intellectual curiosity: have a deep interest about the interactions of customers with our product and dive into understanding all details of the experience.
  • Deliver results: envision the right outcome and put together a plan to achieve it.
  • Great analytical skills: define the key metrics for your product and understand the impact of a proposed business change.
  • Excellent communication: communicate complicated concepts in simple terms. Our business is international so English fluency is a must.

What to expect:

  • Agile, cross-functional, DevOps enabled teams
  • An environment that continually raises its standards of work
  • A rapidly growing company with top talent

description:

We Care deeply about our clients and colleagues and never lose sight of the human element, which goes hand-in-hand with Transparency which we believe makes our day-to-day life easier.

We are looking for an experienced individual to be the first hire of the Business Operations team (Biz Ops) for our US team, based in our New York office. As a member of the Biz Ops team, you will work directly with the Deputy Head of US, and partner with leaders across different teams to drive strategic initiatives and cross-functional projects that collectively further Blueground’s mission. You will shape both where we are going and how we are getting there, focusing on areas that fall outside the daily responsibility of our business units.

It will be a highly entrepreneurial role with lots of opportunity to define where to focus the team's efforts and learn how to drive operational decision making. We anticipate adding to the team over the coming years and we will look to you to help shape how we structure the team.

The responsibilities will change based on the most pressing needs of the business at any given point in time. There are, however, a set of baseline responsibilities that you will be expected to own regularly such as the following:


What you will focus on:


  • Lead end-to-end execution on major, cross-functional real estate initiatives on asset selection, growth and other key areas
  • Manage, update and own business vitals & KPIs that the US leadership team need to be aware of
  • Work across teams (e.g., real estate, finance, sales, operations) to find and implement strategic initiatives which drive P&L impact for the business
  • Work with the business intelligence and finance teams to create necessary reporting dashboards that drive decision making
  • Provide analysis and recommendations to help evaluate new revenue growth and partnership opportunities
  • Monitor our external environment (e.g., market conditions, competitive pressures, regulatory landscape) and derive implications for the business
  • Serve as the connective tissue across teams to drive alignment on priorities across key business functions through the OKR and strategic planning process
  • Build presentations and reports that help the executive team to make decisions without having to search for the data
What we are looking for:


  • 3-5+ years of experience in a high growth startup, management consulting, investment banking, private equity, or similar fast-paced environment
  • Proven analytical skills with the ability to translate findings and apply to project management
  • Exceptional relationship-builder who works well with people from technical and business backgrounds
  • Excellent communicator with the ability to influence and manage wide-scale projects across multiple levels and functions of the organization
  • Exceptional critical thinking skills, being able to solve problems with practical judgment
  • Incredibly organized with impeccable attention to detail
  • Ability to work under pressure and identify, prioritize and resolve issues quickly and independently
  • Ability to effectively handle shifting priorities and adapt to changing demands in a fast-paced, dynamic environment
  • Be willing to dive into the trenches and do whatever necessary to get the ball across the line
Your benefits:


  • Competitive salary
  • Competitive Health insurance (Medical, Dental and Vision), along with complimentary access to OneMedical and Health Advocate
  • Flexible paid time off
  • Enhanced parental leave
  • Dynamic working environment with talented people
  • Complimentary accommodation in Blueground locations. Think summer in Greece and winter in Dubai!

title: Software Engineer, Front End
description:
At Blueground, we are guided by a vision to make people feel at home wherever they choose to live. By offering fully-furnished apartments that are move-in ready in the world’s most vibrant neighborhoods, we provide our guests with the opportunity to simply #ShowUpStartLiving. Behind the scenes, we strive for a tech-powered living experience that guests love, homed in an organization where great people are proud to work.

We’ve grown a lot since our founding in 2013. We are now hosting guests in more than 4,000 homes in 15 cities. We have raised more than $100m+ in funding to date and that’s just the beginning.

What drives our success is how each of our team members applies our core values. To our team, Time is everything, and we cherish it greatly. For us, Excellence isn’t simply a standard, but an exciting way to look at life. We Care deeply about our clients and colleagues and never lose sight of the human element, which goes hand-in-hand with Transparency which we believe makes our day-to-day easier.

We are looking for a talented Front End Engineer to join our Engineering team in Athens and our mission to offer a world class experience to our customers on the web, office based or remote.

We are a tech enabled company, currently making substantial investments in our technology platform, from our booking website and mobile app to our key business internal software, to enable our next stage of high growth.The person in this role will work on our web products with some of the latest tech goodies, solid engineering practices and demanding requirements on UX, analytics and performance.


Our Stack

  • ES2015+
  • Node.js | Express | Koa
  • MongoDB | Postgres | Redis
  • RabbitMQ
  • Vue.js | Angular | Vanilla.js
  • Jest | WebDriver.io | Cypress.io
  • RESTful APIs | gRPC
  • Serverless
  • GraphQL on Prisma up next

Our code sits on Github, is integrated through Jenkins pipelines and runs on AWS EKS & Lambda. We do project management on JIRA, our prototypes and mockups on Figma and monitor our systems and performance on Datadog and New Relic.


What you'll focus on

  • Architect, design and build product features on Blueground’s web products
  • Deliver rich, responsive, mobile first experiences on the browser
  • Participate in SCRUM ceremonies
  • Code in Vue.js
  • Write your unit tests
  • Write your e2e tests
  • Sometimes write your HTML & CSS
  • Automate stuff
  • Depend on a CI pipeline
  • Experiment and create rapid prototypes


What to expect

  • Your opinion to matter
  • To work in an agile, cross functional, devops enabled team
  • To work with a product designer, a product manager and an engineer in test
  • To work on functional and non functional testing
  • To build lots of stuff from scratch and rewrite quite as many
  • To work on performance and SEO
  • To move beyond frameworks and take advantage of modern browser tech
  • To enjoy some quality engineering
  • To get your hands on latest goodies - we’re open-minded geeks
  • A rapidly growing company
  • Cool colleagues :)


Interview process

  • Video call dialogue with People Team
  • Introductory video call dialogue with one of our senior engineers
  • Coding assignment (3+ working days)
  • Technical Interview, 2+ hours long
  • Interview with Head of engineering

What to expect at the technical interview?

You will be called to have a long discussion with your future team members. This discussion will cover many things from CS fundamentals to latest web and Javascript tech. So we encourage you to do a quick refresh on topics like data structures, algos and runtime complexity as well as core Javascript and web fundamentals. We will also try to tackle some real-world software design problems together as we do every other day. It may sound scary but it's really not. We want you to succeed.
requirements:
• 2+ years of full-time industry experience working with web technologies
  • Strong web fundamentals and solid understanding of the 2020's web ecosystem
  • Strong Javascript skills (ES2015+)
  • Strong HTML & CSS skills
  • An eye for good UX
  • Core Web APIs like DOM, Storage, Fetch etc should not be strange to you
  • Really comfortable with Git
  • Excellent communication in English
  • BS/MS degree in Computer Science or a related subject
  • Bonus: experience doing fullstack development on Node.js
  • Bonus: knowing your way around *nix shell
  • Bonus: experience in software testing

description:

We are a tech enabled company, currently making substantial investments in our technology platform, from our booking website and mobile app to our key business internal software, to enable our next stage of high growth.The person in this role will work on our backend services with a well established development methodology, a robust CI pipeline, solid engineering practices and challenging requirements (you won't get bored).


Our Stack

  • Kotlin | Javascript | Typescript
  • Spring Boot
  • Node
  • Postgres | MongoDB | Redis
  • RabbitMq
  • Spock | Jest | Cypress.io
  • Rest | GraphQL
  • Docker | AWS | k8s on EKS
  • Serverless

Our code sits on Github, is integrated through Jenkins pipelines and runs on AWS EKS & Lambda. We do project management on JIRA, our prototypes and mockups on Figma and monitor our systems and performance on Datadog and New Relic.


What you'll do

  • Architect, design and build our internal platform and tools
  • Participate in SCRUM ceremonies
  • Code services and APIs
  • Write your unit tests
  • Write your e2e tests (functional & performance)
  • Automate stuff. Like a lot.
  • Be religious with Git
  • Depend on a CI pipeline
  • Experiment, learn and have fun


What to expect

  • To work in agile, cross functional, DevOps enabled teams
  • To work with a product manager and an engineer in test
  • To work on functional and non functional testing
  • To work on performance
  • To get your head around a quite big problem domain
  • To solve hard problems
  • To enjoy some quality engineering
  • A rapidly growing company
  • Opportunities to do full stack or go polyglot if interested (e.g. Python or Go)
  • Cool colleagues :)


Interview process

  • Video call dialogue with People Team
  • Introductory video call dialogue with one of our senior engineers
  • Coding assignment (3+ working days)
  • Technical Interview, 2+ hours long
  • Interview with Head of engineering

What to expect at the technical interview?

You will be called to have a long discussion with your future team members. This discussion will cover many things from CS fundamentals to latest coding trends. So we encourage you to do a quick refresh on topics like data structures, algos and runtime complexity as well as core concepts of your primary language (e.g. Java or Python). We will also try to tackle some real-world software design problems together as we do every other day. It may sound scary but it's really not. We want you to succeed.
requirements:
• Industry experience in software development
  • Strong CS background
  • Strong skills in one of Kotlin, Java, Python, Ruby, Javascript
  • Strong background in relational databases and SQL
  • Good knowledge of the Spring framework & the JEE platform is a plus
  • Experience in designing REST APIs
  • Testing mindset and an eye for clean code
  • Really comfortable with Git
  • Excellent communication in English
  • BS/MS degree in Computer Science or a related subject
  • Bonus: experience with other JVM languages like Groovy or Kotlin
  • Bonus: knowing your way around the *nix shell
  • Bonus: experience with NoSQL storage (Redis, Elastic, MongoDB)
  • Bonus: experience with binary APIs (Protocol Buffers, Avro etc)

  • Cooperate with QA Team Leader, providing him/her with his/her feedback (through audit reports) regarding the performance of OMs/OAs/Technicians/GRAs/cleaning teams in initial/exit inspections and cleaning sessions

What we are looking for:

  • Minimum 1 year experience in Quality Control inspections
  • Relevant experience in the hospitality sector or in a facilities management company would be a plus
  • Experience working in a Quality Assurance related position would be a plus
  • Ability to conduct technical assessments for apartments
  • Ability to easily commute within the city
  • B.Sc/M.Sc in Quality or Engineering would be a plus
  • Attention to detail (Problem Solving)
  • Very good communication skills - verbal and written (Communication)
  • Data collection, management and analysis experience (Problem Solving)

  • Implement ways to improve data reliability, efficiency, and quality

  • Ability to design, implement and deliver maintainable and high quality code. Preferably with experience in Python or Scala.
  • Proficiency in data modelling, design patterns, building highly scalable and secured solutions.
  • Experience working with version control systems (Git, mercurial, etc.)
